Playing killer feels like a kid that has his lunch money stolen and you have to catch the bullies who did it. But just like in real life the bullies almost always get away with it (especially against higher rank survivors or experienced onces). While making sure you know you can't catch them at every opportunity with Tbagging, emotes, flashlight taunts, ...

Than when you lose you get in chat ganged up again for not being able to get them. You'll get standard lines like:

EZ
noob
LMAO you're so bad
Tunneler
Camper
gg <3 (sarcasticly if you couldn't do anything they write this one)
dogshit player
you're trash

Survivor isn't any better than killer if you do not have the experience though. You'll need the meta perks and knowledge of how to loop everything. Don't think because you are a survivor you can't get bullied. I've seen it before other survivors trashtalking eachother because they didn't do what they wanted them to do. Or if the killer facecamps and tunnels you there isn't much you can do as a normal player. You got some perks that can counter it though. 

Conclusion:

In my experience at the higher levels the game is too much favored on the side of the survivor. It's the only role that I got to rank 1 as well. 

But like all PVP games the less you play or the later you get in to the game the harder it get's to achieve a higher rank. Because there are always people that never play anything else than this. And they just get better and better. And when you don't play everyday and get queued up against them, let's say fun is not the right word for it.

Also it makes you feel like shit when you know what they are doing isn't even that impressive but you can't do anything about it because the game just favors survivors, so you just lose the game and get all the trashtalk.
I am having a lot of fun playing this game. The only problem it's that it keeps crashing. But I highly recomand it!

The game has some fun mechanics and is best played with friends. It doesn't really feel like horror because the killer is just another player. However, the environments do a fantastic job of setting the mood to put you on edge for the game. I personally enjoy the game's mechanics a lot and so I have played a lot.

However I cannot recommend the game to other people for a number of reasons:

1. The game has some very obvious bug issues and have a lot of hackers. The developer's attempts to address bugs often result in the game becoming even more broken. The only way to report hackers is to use the in-game report system, but to my knowledge this system is useless unless you can provide video proof. Even then, I have never heard of anyone being banned from the game for hacking. 

2. Many things in the game such as the rift events (season passes) and the excessive amount of micro-transactions for any customization options makes the game feel like a cash grab. I have no problem with the DLC for new characters but when a new outfit costs over $5.00, I draw the line.

3. This game is asymetrical and competitive. This has resulted in the community becoming extremely toxic. People constantly complain the game is weighted to one side or the other and in game trolling/quitting/harrassment is extremely common (at least every other game).

4. There is only one game mode - 4 survivors vs 1 killer. It would be a significantly more interesting game if the custom games lobby let you actually mess around with the basic game (adding more killers, survivors, experimenting with new killers, adding additional objectives, etc.) it would be a lot of fun to play around in. BHVR seems to be potentially looking into bots and AI within the game which I think is something to watch with interest. The game in its current state (after 5 years) has not added any truly new experience which I think is unfortunate, and another reason I cannot recommend it.

I enjoy the game and the gameplay, but for the above reasons I cannot recommend it in good faith to other players.

SWF is garbage. You will start playing and be ranked with top rank players all because they're grouped with their low rank friends. Fun game otherwise, swf makes it garbage. 41 hours in and I'm ready to quit cause this, thank you developers for making this game FUN FOR EVERYONE and not just survivors. ggwp

The serene night of a cold summer was pierced by a deafening scream, while I was covered in sweat and watched as the carcass of my alter ego was shredded by a maniac, neighbors called the police, thinking that I was really flunked. It's time to put up a monument to the one who came up with the main motive of this game, there is nothing more remarkable than playing for a frostbite maniac, naturally in life we â€‹â€‹do not want to do anything like that, but in virtual space you can not restrain your inner beast, especially since the victims usually behave like in an American bi movie. The sound is one more point hit by the developers, sometimes it seems that your pulse is really beating in your temples. Well, and most importantly, Dead by Daylight really captivates, it's not a pity to waste time on it. Now on the cons, the locations are well drawn with a bunch of details, but they are monotonous, like an American backwater, there are obvious problems with the balance in the game, which is sometimes incredibly annoying, and the main problem is terrible bugs, Behavior Interactive proved to be a talented team, it's bad that Canadians spend time not to finalize the carnage, but to release paid add-ons. In total, we get 7.5 points, by the way, I would like a single mode with a story campaign, because there are so many interesting characters.
Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this game yet.

If i had to describe Dead by Daylight with a sentence, this game is a "Sick, Twisted Version of Tag and Hide and Seek". Killer's objective is straight up to murder everyone, and Survivors needs to escape. It's the only horror multiplayer that can keep you playing for hundreds or even thousands of hours, without feeling repetitive.

     Newer players will get the spook as they still have "Fear of the Unknown", and even though experienced players will get less spooks, doesn't mean that the game will be less fun for them. There's more than a hundred perk in the game available for players to test out and have fun with. This is exactly why the game can keep you playing for so long. Dead-by-Daylight is closer to a strategy game than it is a horror game the more you play it.

     Playing a full-party survivor game with your friends is a blast, it doesn't get more fun than that.
If you're stuck with no friends, don't worry. Playing killer is not much different in terms of the fun that you'll get. As a killer, all the outcome of the game is in your hands, and having that much power feels very satisfying if you're the guy who doesn't like having to rely on random teammates to win.

     Bloodpoint System makes the game have a solid progression curve, no matter the outcome of the match, because you get Bloodpoints, this means you still made progression. Not to mention, the rank system also considers individual performance significantly more than results. This reduces the tilt that you can get because not only do you have to rely to teammates less, but no matter how bad a game goes, you still get Bloodpoints which you can use to buy perks / items and progress towards your dream loadout.

     However the price of the game might be a bit too high by default, but definitely pick it up on sales.
It also has a bit of gore inside of it, so for people who aren't comfortable with those, you need to consider more before getting this game.

9/10 would tunnel blendettes more.

This game caters to a specific audience so it's not for everyone.
It also caters to people with very good ping.

The game can be a cancer depending on the people who play it, you might be against a group of SWF survivors who don't t-bag and don't BM you in any way.

Or you may have a team of ultra sweaty try hards who T-bag you, Flashlight you, Clicking it multiple times to annoy you and piss you off in every single way.

If you have more than 80 ping on the servers, Goodluck. You won't be able to properly gauge when to vault windows or throw down pallets.
